dataset.title: Data from a greenhouse experiment to test the effects of the heterogeneity and availability of water and nutrientes on plant community attributes

abstract.para: Data from a greenhouse microcosm experiment. The experiment had four treatments: nutrient availability (three levels: 40, 80 and 120 mg of N added as organic material), nutrient heterogeneity (two levels: organic material added homogeneously or as a patch), water availability (three levels: 125, 250 and 375 mL of water added per week) and water heterogeneity (two levels: watering five times a week or watering once a week). Microcosm contained assemblages formed by the grasses Lolium perenne L., Anthoxantum odoratum L. and Holcus lanatus L., the forb Plantago lanceolata L. and the legume Trifolium repens L. The following data were collected at the end of the experiment: total above- and belowground biomass (0-15 and 15-30 cm depth) at the assemblage level, aboveground biomass at the species level, root foraging precision at the assemblage level.

additionalInfo.para:
The data is associated with the publication: Maestre, F. T., and J. F. Reynolds. 2007. Amount or pattern? Grassland responses to the heterogeneity and availability of two key resources. Ecology 88:501-511.
The data are in SPSS format

section.title: Harvest
section.para: Plants were harvested after 100 days of growth. The aboveground biomass of all the microcosms was cut at the soil surface and sorted to species. Once aboveground biomass was harvested, the soil in each microcosm was sliced into two depth layers: 0-15 cm and 15-30 cm. In each depth layer all roots were carefully separated from the soil; they were so large and entangled that it was impossible to separate them by species. All the harvested material was dried at 60°C until constant weight.

samplingDescription.para: The microcosms were introduced in a heated greenhouse exposed to natural sunlight but within which temperature was controlled. The microcosms were arranged in four blocks where each block contained a replicate per combination of treatments formed by 3 wheeled trolleys containing 12 microcosms each. The position of the blocks within the greenhouse was interchanged twice a week, and that of the microcosms within each block was randomized once a week to minimize position effects.
